Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row ofdata.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY,SEIS_PLAN, SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.Valid types of seismic sets includeSEIS_LINE, SEIS_3D, SEIS_SEGMENT andSEIS_SURVEY.
Column Comment.2: STATUS IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the status of the seismic set.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.6: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.7: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.8: SEISMIC STATUS: the status of the seismic set, such as underway, complete. Mayalso represent an ownership status (trade, proprietary, spec etc.)
Column Comment.9: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.10: STATUS TYPE: The type of status of the seismic set. Typical status might includeownership (trade, proprietary, spec shoot) or acquisition status (planning, approved,active, complete).
Column Comment.11: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.12: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.13: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.14: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.15: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.16: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.17: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
